title: Inside ‘Operation Absolute Resolve,’ the U.S. Effort to Capture Maduro
summary: The tactically precise operation successfully extracted Mr. Maduro with no loss of American life, a result heralded by President Trump amid larger questions about the legality and rationale for the U.S. actions in Venezuela.

title: Trump Shares Photo of Captured Nicolás Maduro, Blindfolded and Handcuffed
summary: The Venezuelan president and his wife were flown out of Caracas by helicopter to the U.S.S. Iwo Jima, a warship taking them to New York.

title: On a Brooklyn Boulevard, Mamdani Revives a Project Hampered by Scandal
summary: The bike-lane project, a source of corruption charges during the Adams administration, will be finished as planned in Greenpoint, Mayor Zohran Mamdani said.

title: China’s Russian Town Has Log Cabins and Cyrillic Signs, but No Russians
summary: Enhe was once home to thousands of ethnic Russians. Under Xi Jinping’s push for ethnic unity, little remains beyond nostalgia and props for tourists.

title: An ‘Avoidable Tragedy’: The Hazards That Led to the Swiss Fire Disaster
summary: The fire that killed at least 40 people in a Swiss bar on New Year’s Day was made more likely by apparent flaws in the site’s design and management, experts say.

title: Managers of Swiss Bar Are Suspected of Negligence in Deadly Fire, Police Say
summary: The Swiss authorities say small fireworks on beverage bottles probably ignited foam insulation on the bar’s basement ceiling, setting off the broader blaze.

title: Angie Katsanevas Went From Real Housewives Outsider to the Center Snowflake
summary: Angie Katsanevas has carved her own path through life, and her deadly quips on “The Real Housewives of Salt Lake City” have made her a breakout star.

title: Trump’s Attack on Venezuela Is Illegal and Unwise
summary: We know that Mr. Trump’s warmongering violates the law.

title: To Trump, on Venezuela: You Break It, You Own It
summary: His administration just decapitated the country’s leadership; he’s now responsible for what comes next there.

title: Heavy Rain and King Tides Cause Flooding in California
summary: Highways were blocked and a regional airport shut down on Saturday when the latest in a long run of drenching rainstorms coincided with especially high tides.

title: Why Security Guarantees Are So Crucial, and Thorny, for Ukraine
summary: While Kyiv has reported progress in negotiations, and is accelerating talks in the coming days, major questions remain unresolved about which countries will provide what kind of security for how long.

title: Hannah Dugan, Wisconsin Judge Convicted of Obstructing Immigration Agents, Resigns
summary: Hannah C. Dugan, a state court judge, was convicted by a jury in federal court. Wisconsin lawmakers called on her to resign from the bench.

title: Richard Pollak, 91, Dies; Edited Magazine That Criticized the Media
summary: He was a founder of More, which skewered the foibles of the press in the 1970s, and later wrote a critical biography of the psychoanalyst Bruno Bettelheim.
